importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date indicates the most recent update on the ongoing conflict in Gaza, highlighting the continued escalation and monitoring of ceasefire violations.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeframe emphasizes the duration of the ceasefire and the persistent violations, underscoring the fragility of peace efforts in Gaza.

keyTakeAways: Israel has killed 97 Palestinians in Gaza since the start of the ceasefire.
The Gaza Government Media Office reports that Israel has breached the truce agreement 80 times, including 21 violations on Sunday.
A UN relief coordinator conducted an inspection of the devastation in Gaza City, indicating the severity of the humanitarian crisis.

namedEntities.name: Israel
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A state and military actor involved in the conflict
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Israel is central to the conflict, as it is reported to have violated the ceasefire multiple times, directly impacting the humanitarian situation in Gaza.

namedEntities.name: Gaza
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A region in Palestine, currently under conflict and humanitarian crisis
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Gaza is the primary site of violence and destruction, where the ceasefire violations and civilian casualties are most evident.

namedEntities.name: Gaza Government Media Office
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An official body within Gaza reporting on ceasefire violations
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The office provides official documentation of Israelâ€™s breaches of the ceasefire, adding credibility to the claims of ongoing violations.

namedEntities.name: UN relief coordinator
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A representative of the United Nations responsible for humanitarian aid
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The presence of a UN relief coordinator in Gaza City shows international concern for the humanitarian crisis and the need for aid and accountability.

namedEntities.name: Sunday
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A specific day referenced in the context of ceasefire violations
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The mention of 21 violations on Sunday highlights the intensity of the violations on that day, signaling a possible escalation point.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Since the start of the ceasefire, Israel has reportedly killed 97 Palestinians in Gaza, while the Gaza Government Media Office has documented 80 ceasefire breaches, including 21 on Sunday. The situation is further underscored by the visit of a UN relief coordinator to inspect the devastation in Gaza City, illustrating the severe humanitarian toll of the conflict and the fragility of peace efforts.
title: Israel kills 97 Palestinians in Gaza since start of ceasefire
